For the NAEB Savings Account:
"Resolved: That Ray J. Richards, Jr., the Treasurer of
the National Association of Educational Broadcasters is
authorized and insturcted to continue a deposit account
for and in the name of this corporation or organization
with the National Bank of Washington to deposit therein
funds of the corporation or organization and that said
account may be drawn on only by check signed in the
name of'this corporation or organization by one of the
following: President,, Treasurer and Secretary and
countersigned by one of the following: President,
Treasurer and Secretary." (Macandrew/Breitenfeld)
Authorization to continue a safe deposit box was transferred
from Mr. Hough to Mr. Richards and extended to include Mr.
Harley as well as Mr. Fellows, whose name is already on
record. (Harrison/Cordier)
COMMITTEE ON WOMEN IN NAEB GOVERNING STRUCTURE
Mr. Fellows reported that Mr. Harley had appointed a membership
committee, composed of Miss Florence Monrow,’ Miss Elizabeth
Young and Mrs. Mary Helen Umolu, to study the role of women
in the governing structure of NAEB and throughout public
broadcasting.
• REPORT OF MR. MARQUIS
Mr. Marquis called attention to the Report of NAEB’s Compressed
Speech Study which is attached to these Minutes. He also
mentioned that Copyright hearings would be held soon in the
Senate, that S 1090 had been introduced by Senators Magnuson
and Pastore (a 2-year bill introduced March 6, to extend the
Public Broadcasting Act at $55 million for FY ’74, $75 million
for FY '75, and $25 million for each of 3’ years for the
Educational Broadcasting Facilities program), and introduced
Mr. Stephen Millard, the new Director of Information Services.
The Committee adjourned at 4:40 p.m.
Respectfully submitted.
.Fellows
